alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 16 at 4:57PM CDT until March 16 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Dallas County in north central Texas... * Until 530 PM CDT. * At 456 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Irving, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Dallas Love Field around 500 PM CDT. Farmers Branch, University Park, Addison and Highland Park around 510 PM CDT. Dallas and Richardson around 530 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include White Rock Lake. This includes Interstate 35E between mile markers 429 and 438. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
